solution.text:
Discount on toys = _{{2*j}}_ %
Discount on clothes = _{{3*k}}_%
Discount on books = _{{6*l}}_%
Hence, total discount on bill = \(\frac{ \sum (Quantity \, of \, item \times \, discount\, on \,item)}{ \sum Quantity\, of\, item} \)
Therefore, total discount= \( \frac{(3 \times _{{2*j}}_)+ (2 \times _{{3*k}}_) + (1 \times _{{6*l}}_)}{(3+ 2 + 1)}= 6 \times \frac{_{{j+k+l}}_}{6} \)= _{{j+k+l}}_%

content.text: If a store sells all toys at a _{{2*j}}_ % discount. All clothes at _{{3*k}}_ % discount and all books at _{{6*l}}_% discount. Assume all items in the store cost the exact same amount. If Rohit buys 3 toys, 2 clothes and one book, what is the total discount percentage he gets on the total bill?
